website_summaries.verdict: Responsive smart technology, easy app streaming, and superb picture quality put this popular 32-inch model at the top of the pack.
pros: Features Fire TV app streaming for access to numerous favorites
A great pick for cord cutters
Easy to set up and compatible with Alexa
cons: Sound quality is OK but not remarkable
Rare reports of lemons that had screen issues

website_summaries.verdict: Picture quality, vibrant colors, loads of features and easy set-up make this HDTV a winner.
pros: Built-in Fire TV provides thousands of channels, apps and Alexa skills
Netflix, Prime Video, Hulu and more
If you have an HD antenna, TV integrates over-the-air and streaming channels on single homescreen
Many input and output options for devices
cons: Some report faulty screens - fading colors and pixels, failing to turn on over time

customer_reviews.title: This tv was a pleasant surprise
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tv as a replacement for my broken bedroom tv. The picture quality is pretty decent, and the alexa voice control is a great feature. The voice control feature makes it easy to maneuver channels and the volume in the dark. In the past I have experienced volume issues with other smart tvs. The volume on this tv actually allows you to hear it. If needed I would definitely repurchase this tv in the future. :)
customer_reviews.author: Joy

customer_reviews.title: Amazon you have a winner here!
customer_reviews.text: Good morning! Yesterday my sister and I set up this tv and are amazed how simple it was to do. This is our first tv of this size and we are both in our 80s, -- but the setup was simple, actually it was fun. Amazon you have a winner here. We were glued to the set..the picture Is beautiful.
customer_reviews.author: Kittys choice

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Experience - Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Alexa is amazing. Only flaw is she does not understand me when I don't have my teeth in. Soon as I put my teeth in she understands
customer_reviews.author: leevell mccray

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: At first glance and one day of use I think this tv deliverers. Setup was completely automatic and worked flawlessly. I will add to this review as time goes on. Two things to note: 1) I wish it would default to TV and last channel watched 2) The remote is critical for operating so don’t lose or drop in the Jacuzzi. You’re gonna need to buy some long 4mm screws if you wall mount.
customer_reviews.author: TML

customer_reviews.title: Horrible tv
customer_reviews.text: I can’t even begin to describe how much of a piece of junk this tv is and I’d need a week to describe all the issues this tv has. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: D.O.A
customer_reviews.text: Plugged it in, Firetv logo came up, along with a high pitched squeal, and then it shut down... and nothing would power it back up.. unplugged.. waited.. plugged into another outlet.. waited... nothing... it's dead... going back.. buying a samsung like my other 32" tv...
customer_reviews.author: M. Bosco

customer_reviews.title: Edited review: I bought 2 TVs at Christmas. They are both broken less than 4 months later.
customer_reviews.text: Editing my review- We bought two TVs less than 4 months ago. They are both broken. The screen randomly broke in the first one a month ago, and today out of the blue, as my son was playing video games, his screen cracked, like it blew up internally or something.. the screen is actually popping out where it cracked. Really strange...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Price VS reliability
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't stay connected and constantly needs rescan on channel set up. It's also has a lame remote with no way to use channel numbers with out arrowing through channel choices. I would never again buy any TV again that uses a streaming service such Roku or Amazon remote to control the entire set. A standard smart TV with no affiliates is a better choice.
customer_reviews.author: Picky Chicky

customer_reviews.title: Completely  Dependent on Functioning of Fire TV System
customer_reviews.text: I DO NOT recommend this. I bought this to replace another wall mounted unit in my house. It would not recognize my Amazon login. It would also give an error if I tried to set it up with the non-Amazon login method and wouldn't work at all. I called Toshiba support-they sent me to Samsung who sent me to Amazon. Amazon advised that there was a system-wide issue with Fire TV login, and this prevents any use of the TV, even for non-Fire TV. Just what I don't need, another hidden factor to try and diagnose! I suggest buying a TV with an extra HDMI port and a Fire stick if you want Fire TV but avoid a combined unit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen M. Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Price vs. value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV in December 2018, and I am delighted with the price vs. the quality ... all I see is that it is almost the same price I paid in December 2018, today Black Friday 2019. Only $ 15 ...under ... So is it really a deal?.. however, I am very satisfied with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Bolivar Sierra

customer_reviews.title: Broken pixels after a month .
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV during last Black Friday deal . TV worked great for a month after which it suddenly had broken pixels . Amazon directed to contact Toshiba since it was out of 1 month return policy . Toshiba asked to take it to Best Buy Geek Squad . After paying money to send to diagnose center , they determined broken pixels are result of impact . We barely used this TV as it was in guest bedroom with no kids going to this room . Filing complaints was waste of time . I saw similar reviews from others .Do not buy this TV .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GREAT AS A SURVEILLANCE MONITOR
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a surveillance system monitor and it does the job well. I don't use any of the features it comes with, One star off because I am used to monitors with a GREAT viewing angle like my 2 LG's which are ALWAYS rated excellent for viewing angle in Consumer Reports. Samsung and the other companies are always just rated average for viewing angle. I also view this at the same exact angle so its fine for me I would NOT use this set in a room where people are sitting in different places. The picture degrades the more you move out of the "Sweet" spot. (Dead center looking at the set)
customer_reviews.author: Tony NYCTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: YOU WILL NEED AN INTERNET CONNECTION ON ALL THE TIME!
customer_reviews.text: There is one fatal flaw with this Toshiba "smart" TV: It will not work at all without an internet connection! Even if you have an antenna and you scan for channels, the TV will refuse to display the channels unless an internet connection is active! The reason is that they can send your watching habits to somewhere. I should have known better to buy such a cheap TV. I would stay away from this TV like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: J IANNI

customer_reviews.title: No parental control abilities
customer_reviews.text: Giving this 2 stars because I can't delete YouTube which is preset, and I can't enable parental controls only on the t.v., while still keeping my regular stuff on my Kindle Fire 10. So I had to threaten my kid and basically terrify her into hopefully not ever watching YouTube. Fml.
customer_reviews.author: Sage LeAnne Bowyer

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to operate
customer_reviews.text: This Tv is ok if you’re tech savvy. However if you are buying it for elderly who wants to also access regular TV channel, it is complicated to navigator because of the integrated Fire TV operation. My mother got so frustrated she wants her old TV back. Picture quality is also subpar although you cannot ask much for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gre
customer_reviews.text: Very easy hookup.Able to engage Netflix and Amazon prime video without issue.Picture looks nice sound is good easy to mount to wall.I used old mounting frame.Only had to buy 4 screws.My remote for direct tv confirmed to the new tv in a 2 minute data download and now works as before with old insignia tv.My only disappointment is that the Amazon Prime is only for videos and not my music,music or playlists.I apparently have to use my fire tv receiver in the living room to access this data.Nice tv at the the price.I will update if it tanks but for now I would highly recommend this TV.
customer_reviews.author: dannyjk

customer_reviews.title: Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best Amazon purchase by far. I was very hesitant as the reviews weren't great and I wasnt thrilled with a tv being drop kicked on my doorstep however, we have been so happy with our purchase. Crystal clear picture, easy access to everything with Alexa, super easy to navigate with remote or fire tv app on our phones. I absolutely recommend this tv to anyone on the market. This tv is always going on sale and for 100 bucks...you cant beat the deal.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not even worth the heavily discounted Prime Day or Black Friday price
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. Not even worth the Prime Day price. Drops Wi-Fi signal multiple times a day. Frequent issues with apps like YouTube tv, Hulu and Netflix either crashing or not loading without rebooting, again on a daily basis. By comparison, I had a Magnovox before and bought a Song after and never had/ have these problems, not so I have these problems on two Samsung tablets. I regret not returning it.
customer_reviews.author: bob r

customer_reviews.title: Repairs are impossible to get in this TV!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Can be a nice TV but they are provided thru Best Buy and they do not repair these on site so if you have a problem as I am having, you have to take it to them to send off with a 3-5 week turn around time. Neither Amazon, Assurian Protection or Toshiba can be of any help to you. Don’t waste your money, buy a regular tv and a fire stick.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, some minor issues though.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it’s not a bad TV. Just seems to have issues with certain apps (or completely incompatible with some apps such as YouTubeTV). Biggest issue I’ve had is with Hulu. Sometimes if you push the volume button while watching a program on Hulu the screen will go black mid program and take you to the home screen. A mild annoyance but still. Otherwise seems to work well with every other streaming service I’ve used on the TV.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Wifi drops...
customer_reviews.text: Wifi drops constantly, unable to watch smart TV features due to this problem. Dont know what to do to fix it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Cotter

customer_reviews.title: Good TV, really strange wall mounting
customer_reviews.text: Good TV. Only complaint is that the mounting bracket Amazon recommends does not have screws even close to long enough to use with the TV. The threads in the mounting holes are DEEP, deep inside the TV. You need screws AT LEAST 2.5 inches long and the holes are MUCH smaller than the standard screws that come with most mounts. Toshiba/Amazon, standardize your mounting, and if you don't, please provide a recommended bracket that WILL work. No reason I should have to run to the hardware store (with the TV) to find the right screws to fit!!
customer_reviews.author: R. Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed with the glitches
customer_reviews.text: I have had a lot of trouble with this television. When it's working it's great. But it will stop responding to the remote. Sound will quit on certain apps but be okay on others and has other weird glitches. Unplugging it and letting it sit fixes it every time. But I expected better.
customer_reviews.author: Heather R. Hurley

customer_reviews.title: It's perfect for my bedroom!
customer_reviews.text: I love the size for the price! The Alexa compatibility is great. I'm not too great at setting up electronics but I figured out the set up of this tv all by myself! It's light And slender. We'll be getting another one for the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Machuca

customer_reviews.title: Don't lose the remote
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son for Christmas and he really enjoyed it until the dog ate the remote. I have been unable to find a replacement for this remote. Got one amazon that said it would work only turns tv on. Went into best buy and they said the remote is not replaceable
customer_reviews.author: juliet becker

customer_reviews.title: No channel numbers (or number buttons on remote) so must scroll thru channels
customer_reviews.text: Great picture, but channel navigation is not user friendly at all. The 'Smart TV' does not show channel numbers, which fits considering the (dumb) remote does not have number buttons! To get from channel to channel, you must scroll through the menu to get to source of signal then scroll through the channels to find the one you want. It does keep a history of the last channels you watched (in chronological order) which does help ... but REALLY this was the best they could do on a 'Smart TV' I'll never buy a Toshiba again unless I can see/use a much smarter channel navigation (TV & remote)!
customer_reviews.author: Goodtime Charlie, VA

customer_reviews.title: Not happy at all.
customer_reviews.text: Kinda irritated. Probably sending back. The remote comes with pre-printed (burned in to the plastic) buttons for services we don't have or want. Manual says they can be assigned to other services, but doesn't say how. Also won't support streaming with one of the largest cable services in the USA. The television is 100% incompatible with the Spectrum app that works on my five year old Samsung. Would have been appropriate for someone to mention in their details that you're just Out Of Luck as a Spectrum customer.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy if you want to wall mount
customer_reviews.text: This TV VESA holes are VERY deep. 2 different mounts I tried the M4 screws were not long enough...so now I have to trek to "big box" just to buy 4 screws. Other TVs I have mounted work fine, so it's not the mount manufactures issue, it's a design problem. How surprising from a black friday "deal". If your TV is not going to align with a standard mount parts, how about supplying the CORRECT mounting screws WITH the TV!!!! This is for the 32" toshiba model. Picture and sound seem ok....just can't believe the design flaw exists....people literally only buy TVs this size to mount them!
customer_reviews.author: jda

customer_reviews.title: Defective day one. Even though it's Prime, it's from Best Buy
customer_reviews.text: 3 problems. 1. Defective within 1 hour of opening it. The screen flickers as shown in the video. Apparently a common problem. 2. The remote is ALMOST the same as a Fire TV remote, but the button layout is different. That's so confusing when you have 4 other Fire TV's in your home. 3. Even though it's Prime, it was sold by Best Buy, not Amazon. So I can't do easy return options. That's very misleading. I have a Best Buy in town. If I had known it was Best Buy, I would have driven down the road to buy the TV instead of waiting 2 days. I guess I'll go to Best Buy to get a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: JS Bull

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Lags, remote delays, sometimes it randomly will just shut off or freeze. The only thing I like about it was the built in firestick. But even then, it sometimes annoying to try to watch tv on it. Sometimes the subtitles will also be delayed no matter how many times I reset it.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Bebawi

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the worst TV I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible TV. The "smart" features are terrible. It takes several seconds for everything you do. Turn it on, be prepared to wait a minute. Then try to select an app, be prepared to wait. If you click more than once, when it catches up it will go click crazy. It will move the most commonly used apps so you have to search for them, meanwhile puting the Amazon app right up front, it is a frire TV... The picture is ok, not great. And it occasionally just shuts off. Resets and starts again, making you go through the agonizing process of selecting the app, waiting, etc. I would never recommend this TV for anyone....
customer_reviews.author: KRH

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth included
customer_reviews.text: Its not listed anywhere but the 32" comes with bluetooth so you can hook up a bluetooth headphones to it. It automatically turns the volume on and off when connecting the headphones. I'm not sure what version of bluetooth it is but there was a distinct delay with one of bluetooth headphones but none on another so you might have to try different ones.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Toshiba Is a Great Brand
customer_reviews.text: Great television..has alot of features I haven't explored yet..like the Alexa feature..dislike that it doesn't have a nite view as the screen is bright at nite and it's in bedroom..have to put picture mode on PC and it dims some..also the home screen is very busy alot of different apps and suggestions..there is no way to stop sleep time so if you have to leave the room for awhile it will sleep and you have to search for program again or launch the app you were using and you MIGHT be able to resume from where you left off. Purchased Toshiba because I have a 2002 Toshiba still going strong but wanted a smart tv.
customer_reviews.author: Houdinii

customer_reviews.title: Ok but not great.
customer_reviews.text: This tv is a great one but it freezes all the time. I like the concept of not needing a fire stick to hook into tv but the freezing is a down fall. I would recommend this tv to a certain age group but for younger kids or adults that's not into technologies I say dont buy. I bought this tv for my mom and she calls me 3 or 4 times a day to walk her through how to unfreeze it. They should work on that because i was going to buy another for my kids but not this way of freezing all the time. Don't buy unless you are tech savvy.
customer_reviews.author: Mims

customer_reviews.title: What a great t.v and the price!
customer_reviews.text: I was a bit skeptical because the price was so great. But I am happy to inform you that im impressed. Its easy to set up out of the box. The remote is super responsive (a bit pricey to replace, so take care of it). Alexa is fun to use, and my kids love the free Pluto live tv and video games that can be installed for free. Ive only had this tv for 2 days and its great so far. Oh, and I suggest buying the Asurion insurance for $7 dlrs.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Z

customer_reviews.title: Bought it November 2018, it died Sunday, in the middle of ABC's talking heads.
customer_reviews.text: It was five star basically until 2 months post warranty it imploded and died. First it was the transportation between the fire tv and regular antenna -- determined it was the electronics in the tv since the remote itself was fine, some sort of burnout in the electronics -- tho' i found a way to navigate with that (incidentally, I hate alexa, spy in the sky, never use it. Until Sunday when everything blew and I had to resort to my little Toshiba bought 2012 w/a Roku which is still going strong rather than 2018 Toshiba ... 2 months after the warranty ... of course it is cheaper to replace than repair. So Caveat Emptor
customer_reviews.author: Sonja G. Foxe

customer_reviews.title: If I could give zero stars I would. HDMI port does not work
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this tv. I bought this tv, and thought that everything worked out fine, but a couple of months later I bought a Nintendo and the Nintendo does not work with the tv. At first I thought it was something wrong with the Nintendo and changed it two times at the store, and we tried it with a different tv and was fine. Any of the HDMI ports on the tv do not work. And because I did not realize it before the 30 days after the purchase they did not solve or change the tv. Plus, the costumer service was terrible.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: Wi-Fi set-up was brutal
customer_reviews.text: This review reflects my severe disappointment with ease of set-up. The TV didn't have the factory programming needed for wi-fi. The only factor that saved me from having to send it back was the good customer service tech who spent close to 4 hours on the phone with me until she basically reprogrammed the whole thing! My family was finally able to watch a Netflix program, and the picture was OK, although not great. But sending out defective merchandise is just NOT cool.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: If you’re an average person looking for a good tv at a great price, buy this.
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace a tv for my parents and after some studying and shopping, I chose this. I’ll be honest and say I’m not an AV enthusiast. I can’t compare the finer aspects of one tv to another. I can only say I bought this, it’s as light as a feather, the picture looks fantastic, the sound is incredible so I didn’t need to buy a sound bar or anything. It was easy to set up and pretty straight forward and I think it’s beyond cool myself. I actually feel that for what I paid someone got robbed because it’s a good tv at nearly twice that.
customer_reviews.author: Always looking to mimic life more closely

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic TV for the price. It does everything I wanted it to do, including provides an easily integrated, user-friendly, interface for AT&T TV (formerly Directv now) cable tv streaming service. Of course, the quality isn’t that of a high-end tv, but it’s pretty darn good. My only gripe, and why it doesn’t have a 5-star rating, is that the volume modulation can be a bit wonky. I’ve played with the sound settings, and it doesn’t seem to help much. Volume varies between channels and from programming to commercials (sometimes quite significant volume changes). This didn’t happen at all on my previous tv.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Read before buying
customer_reviews.text: Very good price. Good TV. I’m no TV connoisseur but the picture and sound are good. Something I wish I would’ve known before buying : this tv has a sleep timer that you are unable to turn off. You can extend the sleep timer but cannot prevent it from shutting itself off. I don’t like this because I prefer to sleep with the television on. When I wake up in the night I have to turn it back on. Very annoying that in this day and age you can’t have the option to turn off the sleep timer on a smart tv.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby

customer_reviews.title: Great for the Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a quality T.V. I bought on special during Prime Days. That said, if you have a Prime membership and Alexa and you just want to be a couch potato this is for you. You also need a good WiFi connection to get all the features it provides. The picture quality is great. I gave it 4 stars overall because not everyone is going to have WiFi and such to be able to use all the features. If you have WiFi this little unit can't be beat for the price.
customer_reviews.author: dbactor

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed with this tv
customer_reviews.text: For being a less expensive television, this has proved to be a good one. Both the picture and the sound quality are excellent. The remote is simple and easy to use and the apps are easy to figure out even if you aren't all that technologically inclined. Mounting it on the wall was simple with the recommended bracket. It isn't hugely heavy or awkward to handle either, so it works out for one person to hang. Overall, I'm really happy with this. I've been using it for two months and have had no problems with it. I would recommend this to anyone looking for a basic smart TV.
customer_reviews.author: Ionia FromentTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Great TV for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Product came on time, with no defects. This is being used as our bedroom TV and we are not hooking it up to cable just using it for Netflix/Amazon Prime and Disney Plus. It was a simple plug and play. Apps were easy to set up except for the normal logging into every app you want to download which happens on any device you use. I set it up myself before my husband came home and was pleasantly surprised at how quickly I was able to have it up and running. Picture quality is expected from this price range, not the top of the line; but great for the money! Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jill

customer_reviews.title: Great However
customer_reviews.text: This is not a regular TV, had I realized this I may have been a little more reluctant to get it. You can not scroll through the channels like you can on a typical TV. The local channels are there but they are only available downloaded one at a time. We may keep this only because it is not our primary TV. Update : The more we use this TV the more we get use to it. There are only a few local channels we usually watch and they are on the previously watched list they come up quickly. There is no need to scroll to get them, the only downside the number can not be entered.
customer_reviews.author: NB

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use great speakers.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these on Amazon deal day for 100 each. Received both in two days, opened, hung, and setup first one this afternoon. I am very impressed with sound quality and very loud speaker output. Picture quality is great, ease of setup is great, using only for streaming video services and Pandora. Set it up to use Netflix, Prime, Hulu, YouTube, Sling, and Pandora. Opted not to use Alexa, but can go back and enable it at any time (hen CD e 3 stars on Alexa). Remote is nice and TV features are powerful. Great value name brand 32inche tele.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the effort
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a built in WiFi access Smart TV. The TV arrived late even though I have Prime, connected as instructed and get a message that connection was successful, and bang - tells me it has to load updates. Won't load updates.. Idiot Amazon Tech tells me it has to be connected to WiFi.. duh - message said it was connected. Solution I had to use, was to bring a Fire Stick from another tv and connect to the TV and then it worked.... Why send out a TV without current updates? Not everyone lives in a city.
customer_reviews.author: Virginia Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: I love this television! I purchased from a store a 32 inch Samsung from a local department store and I have repaired it 3 times. It’s less than years old (glad I purchased warranty). During the last repair by vendor I purchased this television. I love it. It’s got great color, sound, and it’s very dependable. No signs of problems. This is the first item I ever purchased from Toshiba and so far, so good. The thing that irritates me is that they both cost about the same but there is a big difference in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: B. Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Small, but mighty
customer_reviews.text: Got it during Black Friday and was nervous that I'd be getting a $100 tv, but I'm really impressed with the sound quality and picture clarity for a TV in this price range. It's a perfect bedroom tv. Haven't hooked it up to any external devices, so can't comment there. Hulu has frozen a couple of times, but I think it's because apps were downloading at the same time as watching.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.

customer_reviews.title: Its not so smart.
customer_reviews.text: 99.00 and its a 32 inch smart tv. Except unlike our main Samsung smart TV this one doesn't connect wirelessly. You must download an app, be on a wifi network to share your phones screen. The whole reason I got it is we dont have internet service, no tv stations but spotted cell service.... which we easily use smart view on our android phones to mirror the image to the tv. Not on this ... Not so smart.... tv. Itll have to go back.
customer_reviews.author: raymond bednarek

customer_reviews.title: Log In Error with Amazon Account
customer_reviews.text: For those who are getting log in errors with their Amazon account at the initial set up screen, do the following: 1) With TV On at error log in page, reset the TV by pressing the back button (u shaped arrow left of the home button) at same time with the right directional button (big circle) for 20 seconds or until reset screen comes up 2) Let it reset and it will download updates and reboot. It may do this couple of times 3) Once fully updated and reboots, log in as usual with your Amazon account Almost had to return this but after the updates/restart it logged in just fine. Hope this helps!
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed broke after a year
customer_reviews.text: 2nd UPDATE: THE TV WON'T EVEN TURN BACK ON NOW! UPDATE: AFTER A year OF HAVING THIS TV IT HAS BECOME VERY SLOW, AND RANDOMLY SHUTS OFF! IT WILL KICK YOU OFF APPS, PRESSING VOLUME WORKS BUT THE VOLUME BAR SHOWS UP SECONDS LATER SHOWING VOLUME LOWERING FOR (EXAMPLE) IT WILL FREEZE RANDOMLY AND SHUT OFF. KICKS YOU OUT OF HULU AND NETFLIX RANDOMLY. THIS TV IS SO LAGGY AND SLOW! DO NOT RECOMEND. Brand new in box. Perfect condition. Firestick is easy to use and you can download many apps for shows and movies. But lags!
customer_reviews.author: Billiegirl

customer_reviews.title: It's Great!
customer_reviews.text: I waited well over a year to write this review. I wanted to be sure it would hold up and function well. I read all the reviews before purchasing and I can say for sure that I did not have a bad experience. The picture and sound quality are great and I love the Alexa integration as I have other Alexa devices in my home and they are all connected. They only negative thing I can say is about the remote. Sometimes there is a connectivity issue with the bluetooth remote and I find myself frequently unplugging the TV to reset it. I don't have it wall mounted so it's not too difficult, just frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I unboxed and set this tv up about 2 weeks ago. I like it! just the right size for the spare bedroom. Nice picture quality. Simple remote. For me, the toughest part was getting it synced with our Wifi - but that was a problem on my end, oh and having to log into Prime, Netflix, etc. with email and passwords. I don't have Alexa (I saw Terminator, I know how this ends - lol) so I can't review that bit of the product, but so far so good! I'm happy with my purchase at this time. I will update if that changes in an unreasonably short time.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Girl

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed at 11 months
customer_reviews.text: Ours was great for 11 months but then started malfunctioning. It won’t stay shut off - turns on to Prime Video home screen. It also randomly returns to Prime Video Hime screen when we watch stuff on Netflix. Also none of the 4 channel buttons on the bottom of the remote work. I tried changing batteries in the remote - did not help. We have to unplug the TV to turn it off, so I have tried unplugging it. ;). Got the 32 inch for $100 from a deal of the day, but still disappointing to not have it last a year.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Wearne

customer_reviews.title: Good value & quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tv for my guest bedroom/office and for when my boyfriend wants to watch sports which I do not like. I have cable but decided to get this with a flat antenna and was able to add ESPN and other cable channels through apps. Have not been able to add spectrum tv app, which I do have on my phone. I did not want to pay an additional $8/month for cable receiver. I think this tv is great for price! It helps my relationship so I dont have to argue over what to watch on tv, which for my boyfriend is usually sports. He was very happy too!
customer_reviews.author: Librarygirl

customer_reviews.title: Amazon does not warn you there’s no manual, etc.
customer_reviews.text: This set was a fine replacement for the 10 year old much smaller set that was weakening. But elderly buyer beware. This tv will force into the new world of smart TVs armed with fire sticks (remotes without numbers or letters whose few “button” are unlabeled). You’ll have to call for assistance of a youngish family member to help you turn the thing on. And forget DVDs. Welcome to the world of video streaming. Plus, you’ll have to online to find a rudimentary instructional manual. You’ll love your new tv once you learn to navigate it.
customer_reviews.author: Laurenty

customer_reviews.title: Happy with the Fire TV. Great price.
customer_reviews.text: I already had a Firestick and a Roku TV so I figured I would try the Fire TV. The picture is pretty good but the voice remote quit working after only two days. This made it impossible to switch between inputs (Cable, antenna, media player, Roku stick, etc), unlike the Roku TVs which effortlessly switch between inputs. I contacted Toshiba support and after about 20 minutes they were able to reset the remote and it seems to work OK for now. The Alexa remote when it works is very cool. Say "Switch to Antenna", "Switch to Roku", or "Switch to HDMI 2" and she says OK, and does it! Nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: John Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Horrible black Friday purchase
customer_reviews.text: Used this TV only about 2 weeks over the past 18 months. Went to hook it up and use it again and no longer allows you to scroll through any controls on remote to set up tv. Also can't use Amazon fire TV and says it cannot connect to Amazon cloud. Nothing wrong with my internet and hooked up another tv with a different fire stick and works fine. This TV will not connect to Amazon at all and cannot set up. Horrible black Friday purchase bought Nov 26 2018 & didn't last more than probably 12 hours of use total.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK TALLEY

customer_reviews.title: Great TV
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a Audio-Visual geek. He loves the latest and greatest. He purchased this TV because of a fabulous deal while I rolled my eyes at yet another TV purchase (the cable guy can't believe the number of working TVs we have). It is in our kitchen, replacing a smaller TV. My husband is a die-hard Sony fan so I was amazed that he would consider a Toshiba. He says that it is the best TV he has purchased, for the money spent! It has a great picture and sound. We love the ease of accessing Amazon Prime. So, if the price is right, definitely buy this TV! You will love it!
customer_reviews.author: S. Jessie

customer_reviews.title: My first brand new tv
customer_reviews.text: I'm 32, and usually bought my TV secondhand or when my husband and I moved in together, he brought his tv from his place. When our tv finally went in the bedroom, we waited until Prime Day. Best. Choice. Ever. I know this is not a "top of the line" or super huge tv like a bar. But it IS a smart tv, and neither of us has ever had one. So, it is pretty amazing the features it offers and abilities. My 5 month old sleeps in our bedroom and I use the TV to play his white noise on Amazon Music. This tv works well for what we need/use it for and would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: No complaint for the price, good for small guest room
customer_reviews.text: If you are familiar with amazon fire, the interface is identical so there is no learning curve for me. I could side load apps I needed which is great, no need to get a firestick. The remote is responsive. It is a budget(primeday deal) low resolution tv, i sit a full 6-7 feet away with bad eyes i dont notice any serious resolution issues with the 720p. Has antenna coax input which is a huge plus coz i watch some local channels, unlike some of the vizio panels. However I would not spend more than 120$ for this in 2019, as there are bigger/higher resolution sets out there.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: So awful.
customer_reviews.text: Simply put, this television isn't powerful enough to handle the awful bloat of Amazon Fire TV software. Of all the streaming software, Amazon is the worst. Full of ads and up sells adds to the bloat which makes response time using the remote excruciatingly slow. Starting an app is painfully slow. Of all my streaming devices and smart televisions this is the worst. Of course, it is very inexpensive, so you get what you pay for. I could go on with my complaints, but you get the gist.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN G.

customer_reviews.title: smart TV
customer_reviews.text: I had no idea I'd purchased a SmartTV until I pulled it out of the box and immediately set it up and saw all those cool options on the screen!! The time was perfect providing all the things I wanted / needed to do thanks to having my roof replaced around this time and finally getting rid of the dish on my roof and able to ditch cable!!!! And this one cost even less than my initial purchase of a 32" flat screen TV in January 2016(?) for the Broncos last Super Bowl appearance!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret A. Traynom

customer_reviews.title: Great TV Except...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Fire TV, a great TV, but Amazon has taken over the operating system of it. When I try run other apps, like Dish Anywhere they make it run really so slow, the movie icons take forever to load, the streaming has problems. Any app other than there's has issues. It is unfair. The next TV I buy, Amazon will only be an app, not control my TV. Amazon, get out of my TV...
customer_reviews.author: Wayne M.

customer_reviews.title: Sorry, needs 2 remotes!
customer_reviews.text: Great TV for a guest room -- but does anybody know how set the default to use Dish Network programming? As it is now, I have to use 2 remotes -- First, I have to use the remote that came with the TV to toggle each time I turn it on to the HDMI setting in order to switch to Dish programming. I do have the Dish Network remote paired with the TV, but haven't figured out how to make the TV default to the Dish Remote, so that I only need to use 1 remote -- which is they way it works with my living room TV.... Any tips would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: David Hawthorne

customer_reviews.title: Love the Built-in  Fire TV feature.
customer_reviews.text: This was so easy to set up. I have not had to contact support because I have had no issues and the set up was so simple plug it in connect to Wi-Fi and log in to my Amazon account.I can parrot to my Eco and be totally hands free. The picture quality is good, it is not top of the line, but that is not important to me. I highly recommend this TV for the price.
customer_reviews.author: mona

customer_reviews.title: Great Little TV for Fire Users
customer_reviews.text: The price-quality ratio on this TV is hard to beat if you're looking for a smaller TV that incorporates Amazon Fire features so you don't need to use a Fire stick like I do on my other TVs in the house and no need for a separate Fire remote either. The picture quality is fine -- in years past this would have qualified as a phenomenal picture, now it's just good compared to other more costly options available. For what I needed this TV for, as something we can view in our spare bedroom when other TVs are in use or to be used by houseguests, it's just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: El Dorado Dave

customer_reviews.title: Not really alexa friendly
customer_reviews.text: bought this and finally set it up. well picture is great. it is a smart tv but not smarter than a 3rd grader. i had a cheap tv that had volume stabilization. meaning the sound level stayed the same. wish thi tv had it. as for alexa friendly , forget it. she has no idea how to control this tv. she just responds with "fire tv launcher doesn't support that". the only thing to control is volume. basic on/off tv function needs remote to work. never going to buy a alexa ready tv again.
customer_reviews.author: Pete In Illinois

customer_reviews.title: Initially good
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this TV specifically for Disney +. However, while it worked for the first few days it suddenly stopped being able to connect to the Disney + service. I have had similar issues with it having difficulty connecting to the internet and Netflix (separate incidents). The TV itself is pretty good, and the sound quality is quite good. If you are looking for a TV to plug a Roku or firestick into, or perhaps use with cable or non-smart TV integrated programs then this TV is probably a good bet. If you are looking for the smart TV features, go with a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: snowkisd

customer_reviews.title: What a bargin
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older flat screen TV/moniter. Not only does this function as a terrific moniter, but the built-in Fire TV is even more usable and easier than adding a Fire TV stick later. If you are considering buying a Fire TV stick, wait until this comes on sale again and buy this combo instead. You will be very glad you did. We no longer have a cable subscription, between Prime, Acorn, Netflix and other streaming services, we have more than enough TV. I am changing all of our TV's to this setup. The simplicity and ease of use of this combo makes this the bargin of the year in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: A decent TV
customer_reviews.text: Pros Simple set up, on-screen prompts make set up easy. Apps like Netflix, Amazon video, Hulu etc are very easy to set up. Dedicated Netflix, Prime Video, Sony Vue button on remote. Sound quality is average. Video quality is average. What one would expect for the price range. Supplements Amazon Prime membership. Fairly responsive. Cons. Need internet to setup. Does not come with M4 x 35mm, screws required for a wall mount. No HDMI cable. Too many tracking apps, need to go into the set up to tun off tracking. Cannot control the Direct TV cable box with supplied remote. Remote is minimalist, can be a problem if one is used to a traditional remote.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful size for the bedroom....has all the features of a smart device and seems to work well. Controls could be better. You have to return to home screen to change channels on the TV option. The streaming feature seemed to be slow and not working until the second day. Perhaps it had to upload software before it worked well. Seems to work well now after two days... adjustments to color and picture quality are ok but somewhat difficult to find.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Hahm

customer_reviews.title: Seriously the worst TV ever made
customer_reviews.text: What a pile of garbage. If you are using this for over the air TV, look elsewhere. There are no number buttons on the remote, so direct tuning a channel is impossible. It sorts the channels by name, not channel number. Absolutely worthless. I cannot speak to the smart functions, but I am assuming they are also terrible. The only solution was to drive a truck over it. And that was the best part of this tv. Very satisfying crunch.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Great streaming...very bad Over The Air local channel tuner.
customer_reviews.text: Great tv for streaming BUT not if you are looking for Over The Air local tv channels. The tuner is below par, tiles all the time on local channels. Toshiba is aware of this in the past three model years but even with the software upgrade, the problems persist. Replaced the outside antenna, new rg6u quad cable, new connectors. All my Samsung and Visio perform well ok OTA channels but the Toshiba is poorly engineered. Great for Fire tv streaming but very bad for local.
customer_reviews.author: Sherm

customer_reviews.title: Good Picture Sound Could be better
customer_reviews.text: Good Value for a smart TV - Purchased on Prime Day Special and have been pleased. Works well with the ATT Uverse system and I now have it set to start in the last location it was turned off at. There seems to be a difference in the sound quality or volume with the Toshiba Remote and the Uverse remote but they both work. Overall, happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Captain 47

customer_reviews.title: Didn't come with all Cables
customer_reviews.text: Though the box clearly said that everything was included, there were cables missing from the box. We didn't want to wait to get things shipped back and forth, so we got cables elsewhere. TV is great, though frustrating that you have to enable Alexa to use some features. I had an Alexa unit before and hated it as it always tried to do stuff while we were talking about something else, so I didn't want the TV doing it too. Otherwise, it's good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointingly Thick
customer_reviews.text: I haven't even turned the TV on yet but I wanted to quickly get a review out there for others who are considering this moel. The 32" is 3.3" thick! At the same price point there are several that are at least 1/2" thinner. Spend a little more and you can shave off a lot of thickness. In 2019 these things should/could be much thinner. It is crazy light weight like it is full of air. I don't want to be unfair with my review so I will update after using it. I'm too cheap and lazy to return over the thickness issue but I wish I had known before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Paige & John

customer_reviews.title: Great TV. Plenty of Features & Apps. Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: This TV is a very good value. Plenty of usable features and lots of good stuff. Tons of apps - more than I've seen on any smart TV. With this said, it can be a little slow to respond to commands. I'm assuming it doesn't have a lot of RAM. However, once the videos are up and running there is no quality loss. It really works well, just a little slow to respond sometimes. For the price, you're definitely getting a good product. I haven't compared it to other TV's at this price point. But I am very satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: Go Tell

customer_reviews.title: this Toshiba tv is easy to install
customer_reviews.text: this Toshiba tv is easy to install, the cable connection is really a bad design and is hard to make the connection.all the good channel or good stuff you have to pay fu buy stuff from amazon.or it. this is basically a cheap tv. remote is extremely cheap quality and flimsy.i bought 2 weeks ago. I figure if it last 4 yrs I would be happy. I know the remote wouldn't make it to the 2nd yr, it is very cheap quality. I wouldn't mind paying another $15 if it had a better quality remote control.
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Picture is really good and reception (tuner) seems to be good quality. We use an antenna for our "regular" TV viewing and this TV receives the channels very good. The only complaint I would have would be that the channel guide doesn't have the channel numbers on it only the network or call signs. Other than that so far the TV has been working great.
customer_reviews.author: Gail

customer_reviews.title: Just Quit Working
customer_reviews.text: I had this in my office, kept it on in the background a few hours a day. Worked fine, enjoyed the content. Then just like it was shot dead by a sniper, the tv went off and will not come back on. I changed batteries in the remote, looked it over for any obvious signs of trouble, the damn thing just died. Had it just over a year, I guess you get what you get, warranty is expired of course, so off to the landfill. Won't be buying this brand anytime in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Jude Nally

customer_reviews.title: Not for a child’s room.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sons room. Remote is simple, not too many buttons. Easy to navigate, quick setup. Edit: Amazon makes limiting this tv absolutely infuriating. My son has special needs, even their basic setting is too much for him and he ends up downloading everything he thinks looks cool. Setting up a password to protect from that, then requires me to put in a password for every single action. I wish I had never bought this tv, we are switching him back to his TCL tv. It was easier to maintain and had less things for him to scroll around on.
customer_reviews.author: Lovingessentialliving

customer_reviews.title: Parental Controls Software does not work  -DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: My kids watch two shows - Little House on the Prairie and Lego Ninjago, neither will play without entering a PIN when the controls are set to "Teen", they can watch adult shows under that setting such as Mission Impossible, Battle 360, Psych, Monk etc. But those two will not play. I have spent 2 hour with Amazon Tech Support trying to figure this out and have reset the TV three times, changed the settings etc. I do not believe this is not Amazons way of getting Parents to open up all content to kids. DO NOT TRUST THESE PEOPLE.
customer_reviews.author: Grant M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Purchased 43" 4K & 32" 720
customer_reviews.text: The 43" I used as a 3rd screen for gaming at my desk. Its connected to my PS4 Pro, Switch, Sound Bar (HDMI ARC), and PC. Its been great. Looks great and was insanely affordable. As for the 32", I bought for a spare bed room for a visiting guest. It is an ok set, HOWEVER the tv does not appear to currently support Plex, which is pretty much all I use. There are some discussions over in the Plex forums about this model. I was considering returning it, but with the current sale going on, I basically got it for nothing. Attached a Fire stick and called it a day.
customer_reviews.author: NiHaoYouDoin

customer_reviews.title: Ok Product
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this TV to replace our aging Samsung in the bedroom. Initially, it worked fine in that all functionality was working and available. After a while we noticed that the fire TV would create and strange sound as if was failing, then the TV went dark and rebooted itself as if power was just turned on making viewing a program that we had recorded on hulu return to it beginning and then have to advance it to where the TV re-booted itself. However the picture was good quality and the sound was good for a small unit. I like Toshiba and will consider giving them a second chance.
customer_reviews.author: JLMayoral

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY TOSHIBA!
customer_reviews.text: I have been meaning to write this review for some time. DONT BUY TOSHIBA!!!! Less than a year in the screen went bad. Purchased in July 2019, dead in March 2020. I was told to wait until “after COVID” to ask for a replacement. Admittedly, I reached out in August when I thought things were relatively safe. I was DENIED service. I will never purchase TOSHIBA again and will encourage everyone I can to do the same.
customer_reviews.author: E

customer_reviews.title: Look  ant another brand
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one I buy. The first one didn't work. It sat in my RV for a couple of months prior to me installing. The warranty period was over by the time I installed it. I figured it could have been damaged while in my possession so I ordered another on. This one doesn't recognize a media player or any other inputs through the HDMI slots. It plays fine and the picture is decent other than not being able to watch movies through the media player. I would not recommend this TV to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Bradley J. Hardy

customer_reviews.title: its ok
customer_reviews.text: love everything on it except trying to find bluetooth headphones that works great with it had a pair connected to it but it seems like when it paired to the tv it started messing the tv up it would come up saying that they were disconnected when i didnt even have them connected to it want to find a good pair to use on it because some shows i watch they talk real low on there and cant hear it so if anybody has a good suggestion on a pair to use with it thanks
customer_reviews.author: xmenlover

customer_reviews.title: Good TV for tech savvy people
customer_reviews.text: The tv has a good picture and sound, but has too many bells and whistles for older users. It goes straight to Netflix, Hulu, etc but if you want to just watch cable shows, it requires pushing 3 different selections in the right order. This is confusing for the nontechie crowd. We had no sound from cable one day. I gave up, turned it off, and 2 days later it said “wait for the remote to be updated”. When I did that, the sound returned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Brightness setting is where?
customer_reviews.text: Great picture by I have been searching the tv and the internet and YouTube and cannot find where to change the brightness. There also is no channel button for simple up and down, nor does it have a previous channel button. I'm not sure if I've ever been so frustrated with a tv in all my life. They put in 4 other buttons for: Prime video, HBO, vue, & Netflix but leave out all numbers for punching in simple channels. They need instructions or how to find the online.
customer_reviews.author: LeRoy

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my dad who has short term memory. Was great at first, he could talk to the remote and find what he wanted. Got it January 3rd, and now it is May 5th 2020. The tv will not stay connected to the wifi. No other device in the house has that issue. I have called the company to trouble shoot, reset it several times. I had to input the wifi password several times a day. Now, it won't connect. If you want a great tv for only a few months this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Gabrial

customer_reviews.title: A quantum leap in my entertainment experience
customer_reviews.text: Had been with direct tv for years: it cost $$$$$$ and I had one channel TCM where I could enjoy ad free the content! Now with this TV coupled with amazon prime content and a 20 MBS internet connection I get 10000% the value of any prior entertainment experience TV image quality is a ok Sound quality is good U can ask the tv to search for content Remote feels crappy but so far so good U can stop start rewind So far my news apps experience has been my only disappointment as often old news is all that’s presented which is quite bizarre Maybe I need to do more research or be willing to pay for live news
customer_reviews.author: D Do

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Small Space
customer_reviews.text: I bought this TV when it was part of a Lightening Deal. We have the exact same TV in a bigger size in our upstairs TV room, so I knew it would be a good product. It's exactly the size I need for my tiny dressing room. I love that I can watch the same apps there now that I was enjoying in our main TV room. I can also still use my cable box. Though because I have the "basic" box (no HD) the picture when watching cable doesn't fill the screen. That's not a big deal to me at all though. Set up was easy. I had it up and running in less than half an hour.
customer_reviews.author: MrsLucard

customer_reviews.title: Almost good....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these TVs for our Church... both TVs have issues with the HDMI circuitry. Others on-line seem to be having similar problems as we are and there seems to be no solutions and very little support available from Toshiba. Other inputs & channels all work fine, only the HDMI is distorted. I returned the first TV and AMZ refunded the purchase price, now the second TV has the same exact problem. I'm very frustrated. mardyn
customer_reviews.author: mardyn

customer_reviews.title: TV works great, good value
customer_reviews.text: I only gave it four stars because the reason I purchased it was because I wanted to switch from DirectTV to YouTubeTV, since it is significantly less expensive and has a cloud DVR and I needed a smart TV in my son's bedroom. Unfortunately, after the TV was delivered, I discovered the FireStick and Fire TV is compatible with Sling but not with YouTubeTV, and Sling didn't meet my needs. So I ended up sticking with DirectTV. Had I known I wouldn't have purchased the TV, even tough it was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Karen L. Loveridge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and set up. Great picture. Love having Alexa integration. Have Netflix Prime Video and free TV ... o need for cable box/fee.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Stay Away!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a smart tv with Fire TV built in, IT'S NOT! It's a Fire TV stick with a TV built around it. It will NOT play video files unless you use some funky format for the disc that will not work on anything else, then it's a crap shoot if it will play the file. For TV, you can't just type in a channel number when watching the TV, you have to scroll through a banner, which doesn't even show the numbers. I have a disc with files that I use for all of my TV's, they all read it fine, except this one. I will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Got it for $99 so can’t go wrong. Hesitated to buy because I wanted something with a single foot in the middle for a narrow cabinet but it turns that there is no such thing. Turns out that the base is deep enough so it stands on it’s own without the feet. Setup was a breeze. You can change the home screen to last used so it will come back with your tv screen instead of the Amazon screen after shutting it off. If you put the audio sound setting to enhanced bass it’s a lot better. All in all a good set have to see how long it lasts.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible
customer_reviews.text: Dislike the TV, you can’t scroll they the channels or just go up a channel, you ha e to go back out to the menu. Sleep timer can o lay be set from the menu. Voice commands work somewhat ok, but you have to figure out first which command it prefers. Picture quality is fine but I only use it about 2 hours per day. Would NEVER BUY AGAIN, this was no deal since it is horrible to use. I bought it as a TV to use with my antenna not cable.
customer_reviews.author: Snowflake

product_meta.title: Toshiba 32LF221U19 32-inch Smart HD TV - Fire TV Edition
feature_bullets: Fire TV experience built-in - Fire TV Edition brings together live-over-the air TV and your favorite streaming content on the home screen. Connect any HD antenna (sold separately) to watch live over-the-air TV or stream movies and shows from Disney+, Netflix, YouTube, Prime Video, Hulu, HBO and more.

Voice Remote with Alexa - Everything you’d expect from a remote – plus launch apps, search for TV shows, switch inputs, control smart home devices and more, using just your voice. With Prime Video, Netflix, HBO and PlayStation Vue buttons, instantly access your favorite apps.

Keeps getting smarter - This TV is smart and simple in every way. Just plug it in, connect to Wi-Fi and enjoy. Plus, your TV keeps getting smarter with new Alexa skills and features through automatic over-the-air software updates, so that you always have the latest.

Endless entertainment - Watch over 500, 000 streaming movies and TV episodes in HD, from Prime Video, Netflix, YouTube, Hulu, HBO, and more. Plus, access tens of thousands of channels, apps, and Alexa skills.

Get it all in one place - With Fire TV Edition it’s easy to see everything you’ve recently watched – live TV, streaming services and connected devices – in one place. Plus, you can connect your cable/satellite box or gaming console through one of the TV’s three HDMI inputs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars11,715 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
